title: If a k-pop group has at least two members in their maknae line who are born in the same date and year, considered the maknaes, as most groups have ONE actual maknae? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes but also no, don’t worry i have an example. Here is Cravity, a nine member boy group under Starship entertainment.  they have 2 members who were born in the same year. Kim Taeyoung was born January 27th, 2003 and Ahn Seongmin was born August 1st, 2003. he just turned 17 yesterday but in korean age he and Taeyoung have both been 18 this year.  most of the time people recognize Seongmin as the maknae as he is, technically, the youngest but whenever they are on variety shows or anything comes up they are referred to as “the maknaes” so yes it is possible to have more than one maknae in a group but if you think about it scientifically the younger one would be the maknae because maknae means “youngest” but like Seongmin would never call Taeyoung “hyung”. so if one was born at 5:15 and the other was born at 5:20 it would still work out as my example shows.

So if they’re twins, they usually know who’s older/younger, so my guess is, whoever is the youngest is the true maknae. Or they could just simply refer to them as “the maknaes”. If they aren’t twins…I guess we’ll just have to wait and see if/when that happens since that’s already uncommon for two people in a group to have the same birthday, let alone be born in the exact same day/year (who aren’t twins). The only group I know of who had 2 members born on the exact same day/year was I.O.I’s Doyeon and Mina, but they weren’t the youngest (though they were the 2nd/3rd youngest). Anyways, a position like the maknae isn’t THAT important or pivotal that we need to be racking our brains over what would happen if 2 people born on the exact same day are the youngest 🤣.
